ext_description.p: A Component_feature_to_physical_usage_view_assignment is the association between the and the . The purpose for this assignment is to link the product data in the design view to the product data in the usage view for traceability purposes.
ext_description.note: In an archive, both a design view and a usage view are archived together, with this relationship populated as necessary to provide linkages between the features in the usage view and the features in the design view. Without this linkage populated, there is no way to guarantee traceability between a design view and a usage view, without evaluating the design view and the usage view in detail.

In the case where this part of ISO 10303 is used to exchange or store designs that may be used in higher level assemblies, the usage view is provided to the designers of those higher level assemblies, and this entity allows the interface definitions to the next level assemblies to be carefully controlled. Note that the usage view is an as-designed view. The requirements unit of functionality in this part of ISO 10303 supports the as-required view of the interface to the next higher assembly in a top-down design paradigm. This part of ISO 10303 supports explicitly exchanging those data separately so that traceability is provided from requirements to as-designed life-cycle states in the same exchange file.
This information is provided for the case where a is suitable directly as a feature of the assembly.
Most types will be interface types.

ext_description.p: the assigned_design_object shall be unique within a population of the .
the defined_part_feature shall be unique within a population of the .

A Component_feature is a type of . A Component_feature may be one of a , a , or may additionally be a . The location of the Component_feature in the assembly model is derived from the placement of the associated_component in the assembly model and the placement of the definition model in the model of that associated_component.
specifies the role of the for the Component_feature.
ext_description.note: The subtypes of Component_feature specify specializations of that are consistent with the subtype of definition.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies either a , a , a , a , a , or a for this Component_feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
The combination of the definition and the associated_component shall be unique within a population of Component_features.
The or specified by the associated_component as its shall be the same or specified by the definition as its .

ext_description.p: For each Component_feature there shall be no more than one .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Component_feature_relationship is a type of . A Component_feature_relationship is the association between two .
the first instance of that is part of the relationship.
the second of the instances of that is part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.

A Component_terminal is a type of . A Component_terminal may be a , or a . A Component_terminal is the defined conductive shape for conductors from other components to access electrical functionality of the .

ext_description.p: specifies a string for the Component_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies a boolean value that indicates if the terminal can be exchanged within associated functional units of the same type. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a boolean value that indicates if the terminal can be exchanged within the associated functional unit. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Component_feature_make_from_relationship is a type of . A Component_feature_make_from_relationship is an association between two , where one is used as a basis for the development of another .
specifies the that results from modifying or reusing the reusable_feature in the Component_feature_make_from_relationship.
specifies the that is modified or reused to become the resultant_feature in the Component_feature_make_from_relationship.
